thread.title: Crying time for golfers in RGC tourney
thread.title_full: Crying time for golfers in RGC tourney

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Crying time for golfers in RGC tourney
text:
Crying time for golfers in RGC tourney By Staff | Oct 12, 2015 
Rockland — Golf was made tougher for those who participated in the annual Cry Baby tournament on Sunday, Oct. 11 at the Rockland Golf Club. 
The reason for the "cry baby" name for the popular event is because golfers often are left weeping with frustration — in a good-natured way — due to the fact the course is set up to put the holes/pins in the most difficult places on the greens. 
For example, a hole may be cut in the slope of a green, making it tough to putt the ball into it, gauging the correct speed and distance. 
The foursome of Gil Fifield, Jeanne Fifield, Tom Griffith and Woody Greenier finished first gross 64, while the team of Dean Sasek, Kathy Macpherson, Bill Willis and Warren Marshall finished first net 46. 
The pin winners for women were: Madolin Fogarty, 42-0 on the fifth; Diana Sommers, 2-3 on the 10th; and Kathy Sprowl, 26-6 on the 18th. 
The pin winners for men were: Tom Griffith, 15-11 on the fifth; Bill Willis, 41-3 on the 10th; and Mike Bonzagni, 6-9 on the 18th. Courier Publications' sports staff can be reached by email at sports@villagesoup.com or by phone at 594-4401.
